Channel.description:
Describes a power meter channel.

The General channel provides continuous power - it's the channel all of your appliances and lights are attached to.

Controlled loads are only on for a limited time during the day (usually when the load on the network is low, or generation is high) - you may have your hot water system attached to this channel.

The feed in channel sends power back to the grid - you will have these types of channels if you have solar or batteries.

tariff.description: The tariff code of the channel

nmi.description: National Metering Identifier (NMI) for the site

channels.description: List of channels that are readable from your meter

items.description:
Describes a power meter channel.

The General channel provides continuous power - it's the channel all of your appliances and lights are attached to.

Controlled loads are only on for a limited time during the day (usually when the load on the network is low, or generation is high) - you may have your hot water system attached to this channel.

The feed in channel sends power back to the grid - you will have these types of channels if you have solar or batteries.

tariff.description: The tariff code of the channel

network.description: The name of the site's network

status.description:
Site status.

Pending sites are still in the process of being transferred. Note: We only include sites that have correct address details. If you expect to see a site, but don't, you may need to contact [info@amber.com.au](mailto:info@amber.com.au) to check that the address is correct.

Active sites are ones that we actively supply electricity to.

Closed sites are old sites that we no longer supply.

activeFrom.description: Date the site became active. This date will be in the future for pending sites. It may also be undefined, though if it is, contact [info@amber.com.au](mailto:info@amber.com.au) - there may be an issue with your address. Formatted as a ISO 8601 date when present.

closedOn.description: Date the site closed. Undefined if the site is pending or active. Formatted as a ISO 8601 date when present.

Range.description: When prices are particularly volatile, the API may return a range of prices that are possible.

TariffInformation.description: Information about how your tariff affects an interval

period.description: The Time of Use period that is currently active. Only available if the site in on a time of use tariff

season.description: The Time of Use season that is currently active. Only available if the site in on a time of use tariff

block.description: The block that is currently active. Only available in the site in on a block tariff

demandWindow.description: Is this interval currently in the demand window? Only available if the site in on a demand tariff

duration.description: Length of the interval in minutes.

spotPerKwh.description: NEM spot price (c/kWh). This is the price generators get paid to generate electricity, and what drives the variable component of your perKwh price - includes GST

perKwh.description: Number of cents you will pay per kilowatt-hour (c/kWh) - includes GST

date.description: Date the interval belongs to (in NEM time). This may be different to the date component of nemTime, as the last interval of the day ends at 12:00 the following day. Formatted as a ISO 8601 date

nemTime.description: The interval's NEM time. This represents the time at the end of the interval UTC+10. Formatted as a ISO 8601 time

startTime.description: Start time of the interval in UTC. Formatted as a ISO 8601 time

endTime.description: End time of the interval in UTC. Formatted as a ISO 8601 time

renewables.description: Percentage of renewables in the grid

tariffInformation.description: Information about how your tariff is affecting this interval

period.description: The Time of Use period that is currently active. Only available if the site in on a time of use tariff

season.description: The Time of Use season that is currently active. Only available if the site in on a time of use tariff

block.description: The block that is currently active. Only available in the site in on a block tariff

demandWindow.description: Is this interval currently in the demand window? Only available if the site in on a demand tariff

spikeStatus.description: Indicates whether this interval will potentially spike, or is currently in a spike state

descriptor.description: Describes the current price. Gives you an indication of how cheap the price is in relation to the average VMO and DMO. Note: Negative is no longer used. It has been replaced with extremelyLow.

descriptor.description: Describes the current price. Gives you an indication of how cheap the price is in relation to the average VMO and DMO. Note: Negative is no longer used. It has been replaced with extremelyLow.

allOf.description: Returns the current interval's forecasted price comprised of the weighted average of 5-minute actual prices and 5-minute forecast prices. In the last 5-minutes of the interval, the price represents the final price for that interval.

range.description: When prices are particularly volatile, the API may return a range of prices that are possible.

estimate.description: Shows true the current price is an estimate. Shows false is the price has been locked in.

duration.description: Length of the interval in minutes.

quality.description: If the metering company has had trouble contacting your meter, they may make an estimate of your usage for that period. Billable data is data that will appear on your bill.

cost.description: The total cost of your consumption or generation for this period - includes GST

UnauthorizedError.description: API key is missing or invalid

get.description: Returns the current percentage of renewables in the grid

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State you would like the renewables for. Valid states: nsw, sa, qld, vic

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Return the _next_ number of forecast intervals

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Return the _previous_ number of actual intervals.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specify the required interval duration resolution. Valid options: 5, 30. Default: 30

200.description: The current percentage of renewables in the grid.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests allowed per rate limit window

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining quota in the current rate limit window

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the rate limit window resets

RateLimit-Policy.description:
The rate limit policy.
See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/

get.description: Return all sites linked to your account

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests allowed per rate limit window

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining quota in the current rate limit window

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the rate limit window resets

RateLimit-Policy.description:
The rate limit policy.
See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/

401.description: API key is missing or invalid

get.description: Returns all the prices between the start and end dates

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: ID of the site you are fetching prices for. Can be found using the `/sites` endpoint

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Return all prices for each interval on and after this day. Defaults to today.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Return all prices for each interval on and before this day. Defaults to today.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specify the required interval duration resolution. Valid options: 5, 30. Default: 30

200.description:
A list of priced intervals

Return Order: General > Controlled Load > Feed In.

**NOTE**: If a channel is added or removed the index offset will change. It is best to filter or group the array by channel type.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests allowed per rate limit window

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining quota in the current rate limit window

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the rate limit window resets

RateLimit-Policy.description:
The rate limit policy.
See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/

401.description: API key is missing or invalid

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: ID of the site you are fetching prices for. Can be found using the `/sites` enpoint

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Return the _next_ number of forecast intervals

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Return the _previous_ number of actual intervals.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specify the required interval duration resolution. Valid options: 30. Default: 30

200.description:
The current price on all channels.

Return Order: General > Controlled Load > Feed In.

**NOTE**: If a channel is added or removed the index offset will change. It is best to filter or group the array by channel type.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests allowed per rate limit window

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining quota in the current rate limit window

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the rate limit window resets

RateLimit-Policy.description:
The rate limit policy.
See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/

401.description: API key is missing or invalid

get.description: Returns all usage data between the start and end dates. The API can only return 90-days worth of data.

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: ID of the site you are fetching usage for. Can be found using the `/sites` enpoint

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Return all usage for each interval on and after this day.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Return all usage for each interval on and before this day.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specify the required interval duration resolution. Valid options: 30. Default: 30

200.description:
Usage for the requested period.

Return Order: General > Controlled Load > Feed In.

**NOTE**: If a channel is added or removed the index offset will change. It is best to filter or group the array by channel type.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests allowed per rate limit window

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining quota in the current rate limit window

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the rate limit window resets

RateLimit-Policy.description:
The rate limit policy.
See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/

401.description: API key is missing or invalid
